intro: Seseli libanotis var. alpicola, commonly known as the Alpine Seseli, is a flowering plant native to the high-altitude regions of the Alps. It belongs to the Apiaceae family, characterized by its umbellate inflorescences and aromatic foliage. The plant typically grows in rocky or alpine meadows, where it thrives in cool, moist conditions. Its leaves are compound, with finely divided lobes, and it produces small, white to pale yellow flowers. This variety is noted for its hardiness and is often found in mountainous environments across Europe.
